instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic
threads.message:
Board is ths one: [url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/6532-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a-gpu-panic-and-green-screen[/url] 
Continued here...

Reballed MUX. It solved everything. 
It did work for a month or so now kernel panics re-appeard. Even worse than before (now with bot GPU. and much more frequent)
Any idea where to look this time?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic
threads.message: Yes, it was replaced with a standard non tantulum cap.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic
threads.message: Kernel panic report? Is it even the GPU driver crashing now? Could be RAM stick or a bad slot too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic
threads.message:
It is the same. AppleMuxController crashes.
Checked ram slots and sticks. Same.
Run ASD. Only a battery capacity error, which I guess is irrelevant.

When it crashes usually it does also shuts down the machine. Then it wants to start again. But after a second it shuts down. Then this repeats a few times until it manages to chime. Sometimes even the Status indicator blinks three times.
Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic
threads.message: Another weird thing is that sometimes when I start it up without battery it only sees the external GPU.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic
threads.message: Seems like a MUX issue to me then. Reball another MUX from a donor board.
